data.name: GetServiceResourceClaimError
data.value: Unable to retrieve vault information from Azure Site Recovery. This could be due to :- 1) Internet connection failure or Invalid/expired vault credentials file. Verify the proxy settings, regenerate the vault credentials file and retry the operation with the updated credentials file. 2) Machine being out of sync from the time zone. Ensure that your current machine time corresponds to the selected time zone.

data.name: TimeSyncSkippedTooltip
data.value: Azure Site Recovery is unable to check if system clock on your server is in sync with the global time as Setup is unable to contact Time Server (pool.ntp.org). If your server is ahead/lagging the global time by more than 5 minutes Registration with Azure Site Recovery can fail. You can ignore this warning and proceed to complete setup if you are sure that the System clock is showing the correct time for your time zone.

data.name: UnifiedSetupThirdpartyEULAText
data.value:
Third Party Software License
Microsoft grants you no rights for this third party software. You are responsible for and must separately locate, read and accept these third party license terms.
By passing the “/AcceptThirdpartyEULA” argument to the silent installer, you acknowledge that you have read and agree to the license terms for the third party software referenced here and allow setup to automatically download and install the third party software. If you do not agree to those license terms for the third party software, do not pass “/AcceptThirdpartyEULA” argument to the silent installer.
MySQL Community Server 5.7.20
License Terms URL: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=524803 Direct Download Link: https://aka.ms/mysqlserverdownload

data.name: MARSProxySetupPSMTFailureText
data.value: Failed to setup MARS agent proxy. Please set it up by invoking {0}\bin\SetMarsProxy.exe. Usage: {0}\bin\SetMarsProxy.exe <proxy address in http://address format> <proxy port> [proxy username] [proxy password] Note: [proxy username] and [proxy password] are optional arguments. Example: {0}\bin\SetMarsProxy.exe "http://myproxy.com" "8080" "administrator" "Password1!"

data.name: ServerConfigurationMARSCSInstallFailureText
data.value: The installer is stored at {0}\agent. Please run the MARSAgentInstaller.exe from the location to complete the installation, and run {1}\bin\cspsconfigtool.exe to finish registration.

data.name: ServerConfigurationMARSInstallPSMTProxyFailureText
data.value:
1) The installer is stored at {0}\agent. Please run the MARSAgentInstaller.exe from the location to complete the installation.
2) Run {0}\agent\cdpcli.exe --registermt to finish Master target registration.
3) Please invoke SetMarsProxy.exe to setup Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent Proxy. Usage: {1}\bin\SetMarsProxy.exe <proxy address in http://address format> <proxy port> [proxy username] [proxy password] Note: [proxy username] and [proxy password] are optional arguments. Example: {0}\bin\SetMarsProxy.exe "http://myproxy.com" "8080" "administrator" "Password1!"

data.value: Microsoft Azure Site Recovery Unified Setup is unable to proceed as the Operating System locale selected on this computer is not English. Recommended Action : Run setup on a computer with Operating system locale selected as English.

data.name: AcsUrlAPIFailureResponse
data.value: Setup is unable to fetch Service Registration details from Configuration Server. Please check 1) The Configuration Server is correctly registered to Azure Site Recovery and shows up as Connected in the Azure Portal. 2) The version of Configuration Server is v9.4.XXX. or above.

data.name: COMPlusApplicationsPrereqError
data.value: Mobility Service Install Failed. Below are the possible causes. 1. If Volume Shadow Copy(VSS) service Startup Type is set to Disabled, change it to Automatic. 2. If COM+ System Application(COMSysApp) service Startup Type is set to Disabled, change it to Automatic. 3. If the Microsoft Distributed Transaction Coordinator(MSDTC) service Startup Type is set to Disabled, change it to Automatic. 4. If the service Startup Types were already set to Automatic, check if COM+ enumeration succeeds. 4.1 You check COM+ Enumeration by Component Services(comexp.msc) 4.2 Browse to Component Service -> Computers -> My Computer -> COM+ Application. You should be able to expand the System Application node and see the contents under that node. 4.3 Ensure that Volume Shadow Copy Service is listed under Component Service -> Computers -> My Computer -> DCOM config 5. If any of the sub-steps in Step 4 fail please contact your System Administrator to resolve the issue.

data.name: LogFilePathErrorText

data.name: EnvironmentDetailsPageVMwareToolsExistsText
data.value: VMware Tools are installed.

data.name: EnvironmentDetailsPageVMwareToolsNotExistsText
data.value: To protect VMware virtual machines you’ll need to install VMware Tools. Work with your VMware vCenter/vSphere Administrator to install VMware tools on this computer before proceeding with the installation.

data.name: ASRServerInstallOnMS
data.value: Azure Site Recovery Unified Setup cannot be installed on this machine as Mobility Service agent is already installed on this machine. Possible cause: The server is currently protected through Azure Site Recovery OR an older version of Mobility Service is already installed on the computer. Recommended Action : 1. If this machine is currently being protected using Azure Site Recovery, other components cannot installed on the same machine. So, deploy a new configuration server with the help of OVF template or choose a different server to set up Configuration Server. 2. If this machine is not currently protected, then you can uninstall “Microsoft Azure Site Recovery Master Target/Mobility Service” from Program and run the installer again.

data.name: ASRServerInstallOnMT
data.value: Microsoft Azure Site Recovery Unified Setup cannot be installed on this computer as Master Target Server is already installed on this machine. Possible cause: The Master Target Server component is already installed. So, installation of Azure Site Recovery Unified Setup has failed. Recommended Action : 1. To avoid issues during failback, choose a different server to run the Unified Setup OR 2. Uninstall the “Microsoft Azure Site Recovery Master Target/Mobility Service” from Program list and re-run the installer.

data.name: PrereqFipsCheckText
data.value: Checking if server configured to use non FIPS-compliant encryption

data.name: InvalidIPAddress
data.value: IP address is invalid.

data.name: RecordOperationRebootMessage
data.value: Success with reboot required

data.name: PrereqTls10CheckText
data.value: Check for TLS 1.0 status

data.name: ConfigInValidParamInA2AMode
data.value: The Mobility Service Installation is configured to work with Azure Site Recovery’s Azure to Azure scenario. * If your intent is to replicate this virtual machine using a Configuration Server, uninstall the agent and install using the command line documented at https://aka.ms/installmobsvc_cmd. * If your intent is to replicate this virtual machine using Azure to Azure Scenario, please use the Azure Portal to enable protection as the manual install method is not supported for the Azure to Azure scenario.

data.name: UpperFilterInDskFltNotUpdated
data.value: UpperFilters registry key is not updated with InDskFlt value.

data.name: InteractiveInstallNotAllowedOnAzureVMs
data.value: Mobility Service Setup is allowed on an Azure VM only in command line mode. Please follow instructions available at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/site-recovery/site-recovery-vmware-to-azure-install-mob-svc#install-mobility-service-manually-at-a-command-prompt for the command line parameters.

data.name: UnsupportedInstalledVersionForUpgrade
data.value: The version of Azure Site Recovery Unified Setup installed on this computer is very old. You first need to update to an intermediate version of the software before you can apply this update. You can find previous versions of the Unified Setup at https://aka.ms/howtoupdatecs

data.name: ConfigManagerInstStatusAlreadyInstalled
data.value: Azure Site Recovery Configuration Manager is already installed. Refer ASRConfigurationManager.log located at {0}\ProgramData\ASRSetupLogs\ for more details.

data.name: ConfigManagerInstStatusFailed
data.value: Azure Site Recovery Configuration Manager installation has failed. Refer ASRConfigurationManager.log located at {0}\ProgramData\ASRSetupLogs\ for more details.

data.name: ConfigManagerInstStatusSuccess
data.value: Azure Site Recovery Configuration Manager installation has succeeded. Refer ASRConfigurationManager.log located at {0}\ProgramData\ASRSetupLogs\ for more details.

data.name: InstallationProgressCurrentOperationConfigManagerText
data.value: Currently: Installing Azure Site Recovery Configuration Manager (approximately 2 minutes)

data.name: SummaryConfigManagerInstallCheck
data.value: Microsoft Azure Site Recovery Configuration Manager installation

data.name: LogUploadServiceCmdUsage
data.value: Usage: Install: LogUploadService.exe /i Uninstall: LogUploadService.exe /u

data.name: InSufficientSpace
data.value: Install failed as the {0} drive does not have 2 GB of free space available.

data.name: MySQL55DownloadFailureText
data.value: Failed to download MySQL installer as setup is unable to contact https://dev.mysql.com/get/archives/mysql-5.5/mysql-5.5.37-win32.msi. Please check if there are firewalls in your environment that are blocking access to this website. Refer {0}\ProgramData\ASRSetupLogs\ASRUnifiedSetup.log for more details.

data.name: MySQLErrorText
data.value: Setup cannot proceed as we detected an incompatible version of MySQL Server installed on this computer. Uninstall MySQL Server before you run setup again.

data.name: FailedToSetServiceStartupTypeToAutomatic
data.value: Failed to set service startup type to Automatic.

data.name: FailedToSetServiceStartupTypeToManual
data.value: Failed to set service startup type to Manual.

data.name: MobilityServicePrereqsValidationError
data.value: Pre-requisites check validation has failed. Please refer {0} for more details.

data.name: AgentInternalError
data.value: Setup failed due to an internal error. Retry the installation. If the issue persists, contact Support.

data.name: NetFramework462OrAboveErrorMessage
data.value: Installation cannot proceed as the current version of .NET Framework installed on the machine is below the required version. Install .NET Framework with a version greater than or equal to 4.6.2 for installation to proceed.
